articles.content:
Minjurochong plans to hold pilgrimage meetings
   Pyongyang, June 10 (KCNA) -- More than 3,000 workers under the South Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (Minjurochong) held a meeting of Yongnam district workers in Masan  on June 5, according to a radio report from Seoul. 
   They staged a demonstration following the meeting.
Chairman of Minjurochong Ri Kap Yong said at a press conference at Tahe end of the meeting that they planned to hold a meeting in Seoul on June 12 and "national pilgrimage meetings" against layoff and "restructuring" until July on the occasion of the 12th anniversary of the June popular resistance.

articles.content:
Shooter Kim Myong Sop U.S. colonial domination
   Pyongyang June 10 (KCNA) --  Kim Myong Sop from the DPRK was in the limelight at the 13th Asian Game held in Thailand last year.   At the games the DPRK boys came first in the standard pistol team event, in which Kim Myong Sop played a major role.
He, who took a fancy to sports from his boy-hood, joined a spare time sports school for children and received training in boxing.     
 A distinctive style of nimbleness and calmness helped  him to quickly improve stamina and other attributes essential to shooting. From December Juche 77 (1988), he began his career as a shooter.   Kim was very strict with himself. He trained hard all the year round to acquire the rudiments of technical skills, always setting a high technical height.   
   Since he was swift in removing the action, combined with reaction velocity and instantaneous speed, his coach worked out a special schedule for him.
   With his hard training and expert coach, he could achieve good results.
   He won 57 medals at national and intentional games including the 7th Asian Shooting Match held in China in Juche 80 (1991).
   He is a merited athlete.

Greetings to Libyan head of state
articles.content:
Greetings to Libyan head of state 
   Pyongyang, June 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on June 8 sent a message of greetings to Moammer El Gaddafi, leader of the September 1 Revolution of the Socialist People's Libyan Arab Jamahiriya, on the occasion of the 29th anniversary of the withdrawal of the U.S. military bases from Libya.   
   The message noted that under his leadership the Libyan Arab people have foiled the smear campaign of the U.S.-led imperialists and honorably defended the dignity of the nation and the sovereignty of the country. 
   Expressing the belief that the relations of alliance between the two countries based on friendship, cooperation and solidarity would further strengthen, the message sincerely wished him and the Libyan people great success in their work for the stability and prosperity of the country.
